statement: The system shall start recording expense categories and budget information.
The system shall allow users to specify budget policies within the system.
The system shall ensure that all reports, including those on games and scheduling, are as reliable as possible.
The system shall store a timestamp, the event itself, and any additional information required for the specific event for each event.
The system shall allow guest users to view the final aggregated data.
The system shall allow unregistered users to view game-related data such as red cards and goals, but not budget information.
The system shall allow users to export the aggregated data to journalists or press.
The system shall allow the team manager and team administration to view and analyze team-related data offline.
The system shall restrict access to financial data to users within the finance department of IFA.
The system shall consider the constraints when executing the scheduling algorithm.
The system shall provide guidance for allocating referees to games.
The system shall facilitate the definition of policies for assigning referees to games and enable referees to set their preferences.
The system shall allow manual adjustment of the schedule.
The system shall require approval from two IFA Schedulers for this level of automatic scheduling.
The system shall ensure a minimum gap of either one or two days between scheduling consecutive games.
The system shall allow users to define scheduling parameters including a minimum number of days gap between matches based on the number of teams.
The system shall allow users to define parameters into the system to be built.
The system shall provide improved fan experience based on user feedback.
The system shall notify registered fans when their favorite player posts a message.
The system shall ensure that only authorized channels can collect data about the games and prevent unauthorized data collection.
The system shall ensure that only referees and official channels can provide data about the games.
The system shall enhance stakeholder communication through the incorporation of auto reminders.
The system shall notify registered users of specific information they are interested in.
The system shall provide a reasonable response time.
The system shall notify the referee of any updates immediately upon connection to the system.
The system shall prioritize reporting events from referees during games to ensure quick notification.
The system shall ensure that all storage, computing, and other resources are handled by external cloud service providers after the system is up and running.
The system shall adjust to local regulations and reviews as necessary.
The system shall ensure that German data is not stored outside of Germany.
The system shall allow the in-house IT team or technical team to decide what data is stored internally and what is stored in the cloud.
The system shall encrypt budget data to avoid leakage.
